This Sunday is the International Day of Prayer for the Persecuted Church. I ask that you and your families join Cindy & I as we pray for our brothers and sisters across the globe who are living out their faith in restricted or hostile areas.
We should support as many agencies as possible as they walk with families through the adoption process, not discourage them because they choose to live out their faith.
There are more than 430,000 children in state foster care systems across the country, including 532 children in Oklahoma who are currently eligible for adoption.
The government should not stand in the way of groups trying to find children a loving home by forcing them to abandon the same faith that drives them to care for these vulnerable children.

I’m grateful to the Administration for their support of the right of any group, including faith-based organizations, to help find a home for children in the foster care system or seeking adoption. https://www1.cbn.com/cbnnews/politics/2019/november/exclusive-trump-admin-proposes-end-to-obama-crackdown-against-faith-based-adoption-and-foster-care-agencies …
